[Root.GetFirstName], I you flout our hallowed traditions! [From.SupportedClaimant.GetTitledName] has the right to rule [From.SupportedClaimantTitle.GetName], as I and other nobles have the right to be ruled by our own king. Relinquish the title or there will be war!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

I proceed toward the prelate who my rightful crown, with my future subjects all around, and feel proud and perhaps a bit apprehensive at my great responsibility. I will not fail them! Lost in my thoughts, I start to ascend the steps...and promptly stumble and fall, bringing priest crown and all rolling to the floor! I can't tell if my vassals are laughing or angry at my apparent mockery of our tradition.
Those steps are just too darn small...

Zoroastrians worship Ahura Mazda, the uncreated God, as proclaimed by the ancient Iranian prophet Zoroaster. The ancient form of the religion involved great sacred hill top fires, the exposure of dead bodies to scavenger birds for cleansing, and religious close-kin marriages in imitation of Ahura Mazda and Zoroaster.

The Ostrogothic Gadrauhts is the continuation of the Gothic auxilliary and foederati units of the Roman army. Here is where these elite warriors are trained and drilled to be ready for battle in the service of their liege.

Cushitic believers worhsip the supreme deity Waaq or Eebo, along with several minor deities. They believe that the balance of the Earth is tied to a giant bull and cow. Whenever the cow turns her eyes away from the bull, the earth shifts, causing natural disasters.

My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] is planning her ayana ceremony in order to inherit her mother's spirit, and she's asked me to gather some powerful sacred herbs to facilitate the possession ritual.

I carefully split the herbs, consuming one third, burning one third, and casting one third on the river. As the smoke billows 'round me, I chant and call upon my mother's ayana to fill me with her wisdom.
I can feel her within me!

I watch as [From.GetFirstName] carefully splits the herbs, consuming one third, burning one third, and casting one third on the river. As the smoke billows around her, she chants and cries out to Atete that her mother's ayana spirit may fill her.
She shakes and foams at the mouth ... it's happening!
After days of sacred communion with my mother's ayana, I'm finally ready for her final gift. As I feel my delirium recede, I hear her voice as a whisper in my mind...
A curse upon you, misbegotten brood!
After days of sacred communion with her mother's ayana, [From.GetFirstName]'s delirium is finally receding. What gifts shall the ayana bestow upon her?
A malevolent spirit has cursed her!

I must press further to find something truly special...
There it is! A holy orchid that would make Atete weep!\n...But it's the lair of a massive lion! Too late to run now...
There it is! A holy orchid that would make Atete weep! I'll just take that and be on my merry way.

A brand new--and very virulent--disease has appeared in [measles_outbreak_location.GetName]. The healers have unimaginatively named it Measles, as it presents with small measles on the infected's skin. It causes fever, sweating, nausea, or even death, for some. They think it appeared due to prolonged contact with cattle, as it is similar to Rinderpest, a bovine disease.
May [Root.GetRandomGodName] preserve us from this curse!
Somebody's been spending too much time with the animals . . .

The legions of Rome have remained essentially unchanged in formation for centuries, a core of well-trained heavy infantry with supporting light foot. Here is where these elite soldiers are trained and drilled to be ready for battle in the service of their liege.

After the fall of the western Roman Empire in the 5th century, and the subsequent establishment of the Ostrogothic kingdom in Italy, Emperor Justinian attempted to regain lost imperial lands. He succeeded in retaking Africa and Italy, but Italy was quickly invaded by the Lombards, who continue to contest Italian lands with the empire. In the East, the devastating series of Byzantine-Sassanid wars finally came to end in 628, leaving both Constantinople and Ctesiphon reeling. The prophet Muhammad, who was successful in consolidating Arabia under the banner of Islam, passed on in 632. The freshly-united Arab tribes are zealous for their new faith and see the Persian and Roman lands as ripe for conquest...

After the fall of the western Roman Empire in the 5th century, and the subsequent establishment of the Ostrogothic kingdom in Italy, Emperor Justinian attempted to regain lost imperial lands. He succeeded in retaking Africa and Italy, but Italy was quickly invaded by the Lombards, who continue to contest Italian lands with the empire. In the East, the devastating series of Byzantine-Sassanid wars finally came to end in 628, leaving both Constantinople and Ctesiphon reeling. The prophet Muhammad, who was successful in consolidating Arabia under the banner of Islam, passed on in 632. The freshly-united Arab tribes are zealous for their new faith and see the Persian and Roman lands as ripe for conquest...

Before his passing, Muhammad, the prophet of Islam, dispatched ultimata to the powers of the West and of the East, warning them to convert or face the divine consequences. Shahanshah Khosrau of the Sassanid Empire, scorning the power of the barbarian Bedouins, burned the letter rather than heed its warning. The devout Caliph, reminded of the zealotry of his friend and leader, the prophet Muhammad, has called for a holy invasion of the lands of the Persians. Muslims from all Arabia have gathered under his banner to carry out the Rashidun, or rightly-guided, conquest and conversion of Iranshahr.
Ha! Misguided fools, all of them!
Their carcasses will declare the true faith!

According to the Muhammad, all of Arabia is rightfully the domain of Islam and the Arabs, and should be united under one banner. The Ghassanid Kingdom, as clients of the Roman Empire and Miaphysite Christians, refuse to recognize the rule of the Caliphate. The Caliph has called for the conquest of the Ghassanids to bring them under the true rule of Islam.
Ha! Misguided fools, all of them!
Their carcasses will declare the true faith!
The Ghassanid Christian Arab state, fixture of Arab politics for more than three centuries, has fallen to the Muslim Caliphate. It is a small conquest, but does it herald greater things to come?
Are these Arabs really that dangerous?

The powerful Persian Empire, greatest rival of Rome for nearly a millenium, has been humbled by the semi-civilized Bedouin Islamic tribes. Ctesiphon, the great metropolitan capital of Iranian culture, has been ransacked by the invading Rashidun armies, and Mesopotamia wrested from the control of the Sassanids. The Islamic Caliph now turns his baleful gaze toward the still-formidable Roman Empire.

Jerusalem, holy site of three faiths, lies under the control of the Roman Empire. This is not a situation that can be tolerated by the Caliph and his devout subjects. He has declared a Rashidun holy invasion of Palestine to bring Jerusalem under the rightful rule of the Muslim Caliphate.
What fools dare to defy the might of Rome?

Jerusalem, symbolic birthplace of the Abrahamic faiths, has fallen under the control of the Caliphate. The Eastern Roman Empire, stronghold of Christendom, has been cut in half by the invading Bedouin tribes. Are the hordes never to be stopped?
The zealous hordes of Muslim invaders didn't bargain for the stiff defense of crack Persian cataphracts. They were swiftly routed and sent home to Arabia with their tails between their legs.

[Root.GetTitledName], concerned that Islam is straying from the true path laid out by Muhammad, has diligently searched the Quran with the help of his advisors. He has gained insight into a different way of practicing Islam, a new sect that he calls Ibadism. He has convinced the rest of his people to follow him and become Ibadis.
We shall follow the true path of the Prophet
We must guide them back to the true path
Perhaps this will sow some discord among these Arab invaders
This is no concern of ours

Over the years, those who support him and those who support the current Caliphs have grown farther apart, splitting the faith. Those who agree with the right of his claim to the Caliphate and its lands are now called Shiites, while other Muslims are called Sunnis.

The tribes have waited months for the great invasion of the mighty infidel empire of Persia. Instead, you busy yourself at home with the welfare of the realm. Disgusted, they disperse.

A character of obscure origin, Sisenando was a minor Visigothic noble before his accession to the throne. He travelled to the Frankish kingdom and obtained the support of Dagobert I by promising him a 500-pound plate of pure gold, a Visigothic heirloom, gift from Aetius, the Roman general, to the Visigothic king Thorismund in A.D. 451. Upon his ascension to the throne in 631 with the help of the Franks, he reneged on his promise and instead gave Dagobert an equivalent value of silver and gold coins. Sisenando convoked the 4th Council of Toledo, which formulated civil and ecclesiastical laws, and increased the power of the Church and the king at the expense of the nobles, as well as fully establishing the elective nature of the Visigothic monarchy.

A series of civil wars followed the death of Khosrow II in 628, eventually placing his grandson Yazdegerd III on the throne in 632. Just 17 at the time of his succession, the young Sassanid emperor was unable to hold back the hordes of Islamic invaders that overran his empire. He was eventually betrayed by his own father-in-law, a Mervian noble, in 651, and his descendants fled into obscurity in the far east.

Upon the death of his father, Prabhakara, Harsha's older brother Rajya succeeded to the throne. The Pushyabuti kings were allied with the Maukhari king of Maghadha, Grahavarman, who was defeated and killed by Malwa in 604. The new king Rajya promptly defeated the Malwa king, but was betrayed to his death by his supposed ally, Shashanka of Gandhara in Bengal. Harsha then assumed the Pushyabuti throne and completely obliterated the Gandhara kingdom, killing Shashanka. Harsha assumed control of the Maukhari kingdom and transferred his capital to Kannauj. He went on to unify most of northern India under his control, but was unable to overcome the Chalukya kingdom in the south. His empire would completely disappear upon his death.

Penda, one of as many as 12 sons of his father Pybba, had to overcome several dynastic rivals before he was able to secure uncontested control of the Mercian throne. One of the last pagan Anglo-Saxon kings, he refused to even consider conversion to Christianity. He wrested Hwicce from the control of Christian Wessex in 628, and allied with the Welsh to break the strength of Northumbria at the Battle of Hatfield Chase on October 12, 632, which split Northumbria once again into the kingdoms of Bernicia and Deira. By the time of his death in 655, Mercia could claim to be the most powerful Anglo-Saxon kingdom.

Chosen by the Ansar, the Muslims of Medina, to replace the Prophet Muhammad as the leader of Islam, Abu Bakr is recognized by most Muslims as one of the four Rashidun, or rightly-guided, Caliphs. Abu Bakr swiftly extinguished several rebellions in Arabia after Muhammad's death, and proceeded to invade the Persian and Roman empires. His conquests were continued by his successors after his brief one-year reign.

The Golden Fleece is the hide of a divine winged ram sired by Poseidon in his primitive form. The fleece symbolizes wealth and authority to rule. King Aeetes of Colchis famously promised the fleece to Jason as a prize for a successful quest.
